title: Chrissy Teigen Actually Does Agree With Trump on Two Things
text:
Chrissy Teigen’s Twitter presence is its own special subset of mayhem on an already-chaotic app. She pushes back on “#RelationshipGoals” culture, constantly trolls her own husband, and tweeted her way to getting blocked by Donald Trump in 2017. (The final straw? “Lolllllll no one likes you.”) But all that came to a head when Donald Trump himself randomly called her out — in a subtweet, no less! The president tapped out a thread condemning “boring musician” John Legend’s “filthy mouthed wife,” while discussing an MSNBC criminal-justice-reform special that Chrissy had nothing to do with. When she found out through friends, her “heart stopped,” but because she’s the internet’s cool girl, Chrissy simply volleyed it right back. “Those two things are true,” she admitted on The Ellen Degeneres Show. “John is boring. I do have a filthy mouth.” The thing is, she knows how to use it. “We spent the entire rest of the night sitting next to each other handing each other our phone,” she recalled her back and forth with John. “‘Should I say this? Should I say this? No. Should I say this? No. No, it has to be funnier. No. No, ’cause we’re mad. Yeah, we’re mad!’” Even though she more or less won with #PresidentPussyAssBitch, the real win was the friends she made along the way. “You realize why you love Twitter and you love your friends,” she said. “I had so many group chats going that night of just hilarious people and people making funny videos, sending ’em to me. So, then you laugh about it.”

description: On ‘The Ellen Show,’ Chrissy Teigen explains how she reacted to Donald Trump’s mean tweet about her.
